intro: Pecluma camptophyllaria var. camptophyllaria, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with a compact, bushy habit. It prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
